descript.abstract: SciFish has bathymetry data for all Alaska regions and for many parts of the U.S. West Coast. The data can be used directly with SciFish software or converted into the file format of user's choosing. Data sources include: transformed coastline points that agree closely with the best available nautical charts and that have been densified to match the highest resolution of the point data; NODC soundings point data, translated to NAD83 where necessary, and trimmed to agree with the coastline; NODC tracking point data, edited to remove unreliable tracklines, translated to NAD83 where necessary, and trimmed to agree with the coastline; and hand-entered depth soundings from NOAA Nautical charts. The data will be delivered as a X, Y, Z (lon., lat., depth) ASCII file suitable for ingestion into any database or spatial analysis program on CD-ROM.
descript.purpose: Comprehensive soundings data for Alaska and West Coast U.S..

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
